item.title: A Ping Question
item.description: Recently, I focus on OpenStack things where an interesting network question comes out: If a host machine has multiple network interfaces, is it possible to ping all of them from another host? To be clearer, we assume that Host A has a unique network interface 192.168.11.0/24, Host B has 2 interfaces: 192.168.125.0/24 and 192.168.126.0/24. Meanwhile, the 3 interfaces are connected by a router, as the graph illustrated. If we look at the routing table of Host B, we’ll find something like

item.title: 浅谈Docker Bridge网络模式
item.description: 本文将简单介绍一下Docker的3中网络模式，然后着重介绍bridge模式的数据传输过程，浅谈Docker容器与宿主机 之间，以及与外部世界的
